value.name: Family of Iremamber Sykap sues city and officers, alleges intimidation by Honolulu police
value.description: The family of an unarmed 16-year-old boy shot and killed by police last month filed a wrongful death lawsuit against the city and the officers who allegedly opened fire at the car he was driving while it was at a complete stop on Kalakaua Avenue.

value.name: Sykap Family Sues Honolulu Police, Alleging Wrongful Death Of Teen
value.description: Family members of Iremamber Sykap, a 16-year-old Micronesian boy killed by Honolulu police last month, are suing the city and officers involved in his death, attorney Eric Seitz announced on Friday. Akiwine Sykap,

value.name: Sykap family files wrongful death lawsuit against City, HPD officers
value.description: The lawsuit claims that officers with the Honolulu Police Department (HPD) have been harassing and threatening family members related to Iremamber Sykap, who was killed on April 5. It also alleges that the HPD is withholding information about the shooting.

value.name: Family sues after Honolulu police fatally shoot 16-year-old
value.description: Police said Iremamber Sykap was driving a stolen Honda linked to a burglary, purse snatching, car theft and armed robbery and led officers on a chase before the shooting. The lawsuit alleges ...

value.name: Micronesians Feel Hatred in Hawaii, Decry Police Shooting
value.description: Some in the Micronesian community say the April 5 shooting of Iremamber Sykap highlights the racism they face in Hawaii, a place they expected to be more welcoming to fellow islanders. Police say ...

value.name: 'off the grid,' a new art show at Yale, reveals bonds that can form even in isolation
value.description: Artists often work in isolation, holing up in their studios for hours on end, but a new project mounted by New Haven’s Yale Schwarzman Center (YSC) proves that art made off the grid during a pandemic can create bonds between participants.
